alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 10:17AM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. Lodge Creek near International Border affecting Blaine and Hill Counties. For the Milk River...including Harlem...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lodge Creek...including International Border...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lodge Creek near International Border. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:25 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:25 AM MDT Wednesday was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this weekend. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 04/22/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM MDT.
